text: is it possible to edit Jenkins jobs using GUI? just for debugging purposes
it needs privilege.
could anybody give me such privilege?

<@U0XR6J961>: regarding keeping ‘chaincode' in the state instead of in the chain - I had made some related changes in <@U0ULK2JPP>’s branch at <https://github.com/muralisrini/fabric/blob/uber_chaincode/core/chaincode/exectransaction.go#L88>. This change does not include the chaincode code itself though.
<@U18D82GJH> do you know how I would need to modify `membersrvc.yaml` and `mycreds.json` to run the marbles example on my machine?
<@U1T1PHTCL>: sorry.. not sure…
pls somebody review this: <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/313/>
<@U1AU8DRQR>: my one big comment with that PR, seems like users coming in via SDK won’t be excercising this path at all ?
I could be wrong...
does the SDK send a TX including its ID?
I believe so but we should double check
could you comment this to there? to remind me, tomorrow I will have to check this
certainly
actually I thought I did but I don’t see it there
does the sdk use grpc?
do any of you guys know how I can go about running the marbles example locally on my machine?
<https://github.com/IBM-Blockchain/marbles/blob/master/tutorial_part1.md#run-marbles-on-local-machine>
that one
<@U1AU8DRQR>: I believe so but we should take this to fabric-sdk and get SDK expert’s help

I can get to `Server Up - localhost:3000 ` but not to `Websocket Up` I guess because I need to properly configure \ synchronize `membersrvc.yaml` & `mycreds.json` , but- does anyone know how to go about that?

<@U0ULK2JPP>: I think I have found the sending part. for me, it seems to use plain socket. it creates a TX and it also generates an ID. I have to find out how this is handled from fabric side. In this case, if the ID is not a Bitcoin style TXID (like the one I am introducing in my commit), the TX will be impossible to be found using the SDK given ID.
So I will have to modify this part of the SDK to use content generated IDs.
what do you think?
<@U1AU8DRQR>: possibly, I think it’d depend on how generous we’d want it to be. We probably need to cover all kinds of transactions…  we’ll need to run this by <@U0S5KF44D> and others.
<@U0ULK2JPP>: please have a look at my comment in <#C14011Q9M>
ok

A Gerrit-related question: I need to rebase a changeset that's already been pushed to Gerrit. I believe amending a change (as described here: <https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Gerrit/Tutorial#Amending_a_change_.28your_own_or_someone_else.27s.29>) is how I should go about it. Can someone confirm? (/cc <@U0KM61BCP> who might know)
<@U0XQ35CDD>: thanks to <@U0KM61BCP> :
I had the same question over the weekend and the above helped me

<@U0ULK2JPP>: Thank you. These are instructions on how to rebase in general though, right? (Unless I'm missing something, which I might be.) I'm wondering how the rebase should be handled in terms of an existing changeset in Gerrit.
just making sure we are on the same page… here’s what I was running into
I had changeset for review in gerritt
a day later it was flagged with merge conflicts
so I had to rebase and push on top of that same original changeset
I used the above instructions to do that
<@U0ULK2JPP>: My situation is the same. Looks like no special treatment is necessary then. Thanks!
kostas: as long as you use the same change ids Gerrit should stitch it up nicely
Gotcha.
A quick heads-up:  Chris Ferris' change which reassigned ports in Fabric has been merged and we all need to rebuild our dev-environments.
Please also see <http://lists.hyperledger.org/pipermail/hyperledger-fabric/2016-August/000189.html> and <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/289> for more info.
<@U0KM61BCP>: <@U0ULK2JPP> <@U0XQ35CDD> now it have several documents describe the submit amend rebase changes, but not quite consistence
could you make a standard guide for this include both use git review or not

I have a changeset (<https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/365/>) to let unittesting be done on chaincode with a nice interface.... problem is the Jenkins build fails because I've changed the interface and the build relies on artifacts outside of hyperledger/fabric that I can't easily update

does anyone have any suggestions about what I should do? I can't "fix" Jenkins within a Gerrit review because of the outside dependencies... I also don't think it's a good idea to remove the tests that fail
